newsitem.title: USA: U.S. blue chip economists boost GDP forecast again.
newsitem.headline: U.S. blue chip economists boost GDP forecast again.

text.p: U.S. economists in the closely watched Blue Chip Economic Indicators survey have again boosted their forecast for gross domestic product growth in 1997.
The consensus GDP forecast in the March poll rose to 2.6 percent from 2.5 percent in the February survey. The consensus had increased in February from 2.3 percent in January.
The forecast for the Consumer Price Index in 1997 edged down in March to 2.9 percent from 3.0 percent in February.
Looking ahead to 1998, the March Blue Chip forecast calls for a slowing in GDP growth to 2.1 percent with a CPI reading of 3.0 percent.
